meanings.definition: A device that takes a single input signal and routes it to one of several output lines.
meanings.sent1: The demultiplexers in the computer lab help send data to different screens.
meanings.sent2: The technician installed demultiplexers to direct the internet connection to various devices.
meanings.sent3: Why did the demultiplexers go to therapy? They couldn't decide which line to choose!
meanings.sent4: The demultiplexers acted like traffic cops, guiding the information flow to different destinations.
meanings.sent5: The demultiplexers were like traffic lights, controlling the data flow in different directions.

meanings.definition: A component used in digital electronics to separate a multiplexed signal into individual signals.
meanings.sent1: The demultiplexers split the combined signal into separate streams for analysis.
meanings.sent2: Engineers rely on demultiplexers to break down complex data into manageable parts.
meanings.sent3: Why did the demultiplexers throw a party? To celebrate their signal-separating skills!
meanings.sent4: The demultiplexers were like detectives, unraveling the mixed-up signals to reveal the truth.
meanings.sent5: The demultiplexers were like magic wands, transforming one signal into many separate ones.
